titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison -- RICHARD, a dark Griff, about thirty-eight years old, five feet seven inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. Bernard. ALECK, a bright Mulatto, about thirty-one years old, five feet seven and a half inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. Forrestall. JOHN, a Black, about forty-five years old, five feet four inches high ; says he belongs to Mr. Webster, down the Coast. The owners will please comply with the law respecting them. J. WORRALL, Warden. NewOrleans, April 18, 1852 ap12 1aw3w
mods.note: Mr. Bernard; Mr. Forrestall; Mr. Webster

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
